description: The electricity dataset contains data from the Australian New South Wales Electricity Market, where prices are not fixed and are affected by demand and supply. Prices are set every five minutes. The dataset includes electricity transfers between New South Wales and Victoria states to alleviate fluctuations. Each instance represents a 30-minute period with demand, price, and transfer information.
source: UCI Machine Learning Repository via OpenML
creator: M. Harries, J. Gama, A. Bifet

feature_descriptions.date: Date of the measurement, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.period: Time of the measurement (1-48) in half hour intervals over 24 hours, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.nswprice: Electricity price in New South Wales, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.nswdemand: Electricity demand in New South Wales, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.vicprice: Electricity price in Victoria, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.vicdemand: Electricity demand in Victoria, normalized between 0 and 1
feature_descriptions.transfer: Scheduled electricity transfer between both states, normalized between 0 and 1

target_values.UP: Price went up in New South Wales relative to a 24 hour moving average
target_values.DOWN: Price went down in New South Wales relative to a 24 hour moving average

use_case: Predicting electricity price movement for market analysis, trading strategies, and understanding demand-supply dynamics in deregulated electricity markets
ethical_considerations: The dataset represents real market data and should be used responsibly. Predictions should not be used for market manipulation or unfair trading practices.

citations.author: M. Harries
citations.title: Splice-2 comparative evaluation: Electricity pricing
citations.venue: Technical report, The University of South Wales

citations.author: J. Gama, P. Medas, G. Castillo, and P. Rodrigues
citations.title: Learning with drift detection
citations.venue: SBIA Brazilian Symposium on Artificial Intelligence

original_source.publication: M. Harries: Splice-2 comparative evaluation: Electricity pricing
